snippet: Janine Gibson, the paper’s editor in chief of its United States operations, will return to London and will be replaced by Katherine Viner.
abstract: Guardian newspaper says it will make broad changes among its most senior editors in 2014, announcing that Janine Gibson, editor in chief of its operations in United States, will return to London to become editor in chief of theguardian.com and a deputy editor within the larger organization.
lead_paragraph: Janine Gibson, the paper’s editor in chief of its United States operations, will return to London and will be replaced by Katherine Viner.

headline.print_headline: Guardian Shuffles Its Editors in America and Overseas
